title: Fire Meets Zero Gravity As NASA Preps for Major Spacewalks - SciTechDaily
summary:
Fire Meets Zero Gravity As NASA Preps for Major Spacewalks

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NASA

The article discusses recent activities aboard the International Space Station (ISS) as NASA prepares for upcoming spacewalks and conducts important research on fire behavior in microgravity and exercise effects on astronauts.

  • The crew on the ISS is focused on microgravity research related to fire safety and exercise science.
  • A spacewalk is planned to repair and enhance scientific hardware on the ISS.
  • NASA Flight Engineers Don Pettit and Nick Hague are involved in both experiments and preparations for the spacewalks.
  • Pettit is working with combustion experiments to improve fire safety protocols for future missions.
  • Training for the astronauts includes using advanced exercise equipment to monitor physical health in space.
  • Two spacewalks are scheduled for January 16 and January 23 to address specific maintenance and upgrades on the ISS.
  • International collaboration takes place among NASA and Roscosmos engineers to prepare for future missions.
NASA managers will hold a preview briefing of the upcoming spacewalks on NASA+.

This preparation showcases not only the ongoing work within the ISS but also the dedication of NASA and international partners to advancing space exploration even amidst challenges.
newTitle: Fire Meets Zero Gravity As NASA Preps for Major Spacewalks

OnePlus 13, 13R support Jio 5.5G network: What does that mean for the user - India Today
summary:
OnePlus 13, 13R support Jio 5.5G network: What does that mean for the user

Published On: Jan 9, 2025 | Source: Divya Bhati

OnePlus has launched its new OnePlus 13 series in India with support for the 5.5G network, marking a significant upgrade in mobile connectivity for users.

  • The OnePlus 13 and 13R are the first smartphones in India to support the 5.5G network.
  • The 5.5G technology, developed with Jio, allows devices to connect to multiple network cells, enhancing speed and reducing latency.
  • A live demo showcased the OnePlus 13 achieving download speeds of over 1,000 Mbps on the 5.5G network.
  • The new network provides benefits for streaming, gaming, and clearer voice calls in challenging environments.
“The OnePlus 13 series are the first devices to feature 5.5G in India, thanks to our partnership with Jio,” says James Paterson, OnePlus senior global PR manager.

This launch emphasizes OnePlus's commitment to enhancing user experience through advanced technology, tailored specifically for Indian conditions.
newTitle: OnePlus 13, 13R support Jio 5.5G network: What does that mean for the user

title: An extra 10 gram of THIS nutrient can help in weight loss: Expert - The Times of India
summary:
An extra 10 gram of THIS nutrient can help in weight loss: Expert

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: The Mirror UK

Weight loss is challenging, and dietary fiber plays a crucial role in this journey. Experts emphasize that increasing fiber intake is essential for weight management and overall health.

  • Fiber is a type of carbohydrate found in plant-based foods that the body cannot digest.
  • There are two types of fiber: soluble and insoluble, each offering different health benefits.
  • Dr. Binita Kalaria highlights that most adults have a daily fiber deficit of about 10 grams.
  • To meet the recommended 30 grams of daily fiber, individuals can swap refined grains for whole grains and include fiber-rich foods in their diet.
“Most people have a significant daily ‘fibre gap’ of around 10 grams a day,” says Dr. Binita Kalaria.

With a few changes in dietary habits, anyone can increase their fiber intake and improve their chances of successful weight loss.
newTitle: Extra Fiber: The Key to Effective Weight Loss

JAXA deploys first ever wooden satellite in space from ISS - WION
summary:
JAXA Deploys First Ever Wooden Satellite in Space from ISS

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 Source: Wion

LignoSat, the world’s first wooden satellite, launched into orbit last month to explore the potential of wood in space applications.

  • LignoSat was delivered to the International Space Station aboard a SpaceX Dragon cargo capsule in November 2024.
  • The satellite is made from honoki magnolia wood and uses a traditional Japanese wood-joining technique.
  • Over its six-month mission, it will assess wood's performance versus traditional materials like aluminum and titanium.
  • LignoSat will monitor the effects of extreme temperatures and radiation in space.
  • The project aims to inform future designs for habitats on the Moon or Mars using sustainable materials.
  • It also aims to reduce space debris impact by ensuring complete combustion upon re-entry.
“With timber, a material we can produce ourselves, we could build habitats and work in space indefinitely,” said Takao Doi, an astronaut and researcher.

This innovative project marks a significant step towards utilizing sustainable materials in space exploration.
newTitle: JAXA Deploys First Ever Wooden Satellite in Space from ISS

100,000 flee, 1,500 buildings destroyed as Los Angeles wildfires race unchecked - Hindustan Times
summary:
100,000 flee, 1,500 buildings destroyed as Los Angeles wildfires race unchecked

Date: Jan 09, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Wildfires have wreaked havoc in the Los Angeles region, forcing over 100,000 residents to evacuate and causing significant destruction, including the loss of many celebrity homes.

  • At least five people have perished in the wildfires affecting Los Angeles.
  • Approximately 1,500 buildings, including homes in affluent areas, have been destroyed.
  • Evacuations have affected numerous celebrities such as Paris Hilton and Mandy Moore.
  • A new fire erupted in the Hollywood Hills, prompting more evacuations.
  • Firefighting efforts are being assisted by thousands of firefighters from other states.
  • Hurricane-force Santa Ana winds are exacerbating the situation.
  • Water shortages are complicating firefighting efforts in some regions.
  • President Biden has declared a federal disaster, providing aid for those impacted.
  • Many residents remain unsure about the status of their homes amidst ongoing fires.
  • Experts attribute the wildfires to climate change and extreme weather conditions.
“Meteorologists highlight the role of climate change in worsening the wildfires.”

The ongoing wildfires in Los Angeles represent a significant threat to life and property, with ongoing evacuations and dire circumstances affecting thousands.
newTitle: Over 100,000 Evacuate as Wildfires Devastate Los Angeles

title: 'Pushpa 2' worldwide box office collection day 35: The Allu Arjun starrer is Rs 230 crore away from beati - TOI Etimes
summary:
'Pushpa 2' worldwide box office collection day 35

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

After 35 days in theaters, Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2' has amassed an impressive worldwide box office collection of Rs 1,840 crores, which places it just Rs 230 crore short of dethroning Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'.

  • The film has made Rs 2.15 crore on day 35, bringing its total domestic collection to Rs 1213 crore.
  • 'Pushpa 2' has surpassed the box office collection of 'Baahubali 2', making it one of the highest-grossing films.
  • An extended version of the film will be released on January 17, but the release is delayed due to technical reasons.
  • Competition from Ram Charan's 'Game Changer' releasing on January 14 may affect 'Pushpa 2's screening availability.
'Pushpa 2' may face reduced screens, impacting its chances to surpass 'Dangal' as a new competitor arrives.

The race against time for 'Pushpa 2' continues as it endeavors to break through the remaining barriers for box office supremacy.
newTitle: 'Pushpa 2' Box Office Hits Rs 1831 Crore, Needs Rs 230 Crore More to Topple 'Dangal'

Elon Musk looking to oust UK PM Keir Starmer? Report suggests efforts at destabilisation - Deccan Herald
summary:
Elon Musk looking to oust UK PM Keir Starmer? Report suggests efforts at destabilisation

Published: 09 January 2025, Source: The Financial Times

Tech billionaire Elon Musk is reportedly collaborating with his allies to find ways to depose Keir Starmer as the UK Prime Minister in the lead-up to the next general elections.

  • Musk is exploring support for alternative political movements, particularly Reform UK, led by Nigel Farage.
  • The billionaire has voiced that the Reform UK party "needs a new leader" and is considering candidates.
  • Rupert Lowe, a Reform UK MP, has emerged as a potential candidate for leadership replacement.
  • Musk has accused PM Starmer of being complicit in significant issues facing the UK.
  • His involvement in UK politics includes calling for a national investigation into grooming cases affecting girls.
“The Reform UK party needs a new leader,” Musk has stated, indicating a significant shift in political dynamics.

This involvement of Musk in UK politics signifies a potentially transformative period ahead, highlighting the influence he seeks to exert on British political leadership.
newTitle: Elon Musk's Political Aspirations: Efforts to Oust UK PM Keir Starmer Revealed

title: 'Intensely Fake': NASA astronaut's recent aurora video from space sparks authenticity debate online - Moneycontrol
summary:
'Intensely Fake': NASA Astronaut's Recent Aurora Video Sparks Authenticity Debate Online

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

NASA astronaut Don Pettit has shared a mesmerizing video showcasing vibrant green auroras seen from the International Space Station (ISS). The clip, shared on January 6 via X, left viewers in awe and sparked debates about its authenticity.

  • The nine-second video highlights the green glow of auroras created by charged particles from the Sun interacting with Earth’s magnetic field.
  • Pettit captioned the post, “Flying over aurora; intensely green.”
  • Social media reacted with a mix of admiration and skepticism regarding the authenticity of the video.
“Flying over aurora; intensely green.” - Don Pettit (@astro_Pettit)

Comments ranged from awe to disbelief, with one viewer exclaiming, “Oh my goodness, wow!” while another questioned its effect on equipment.

“Oh my goodness wow” - Jack Beyer (@thejackbeyer)

The video continues to captivate and divide audiences online.
newTitle: 'Intensely Fake': NASA Astronaut's Recent Aurora Video Sparks Authenticity Debate Online

Steve Smith to lead Australia in Sri Lanka - Cricbuzz
summary:
Steve Smith to Lead Australia in Sri Lanka

Publication Date: Thu, Jan 9, 2025
Source: Cricbuzz

Steve Smith has been appointed as the captain of the Australian cricket team for their upcoming tour of Sri Lanka, as Pat Cummins is on paternity leave and recovering from an ankle injury.

  • Pat Cummins is unavailable due to paternity leave and an ankle issue.
  • Josh Hazlewood is sidelined with an injury.
  • Mitchell Marsh has been dropped from the team.
  • The squad includes three frontline pacers: Mitchell Starc, Scott Boland, and Sean Abbott.
  • Nathan McSweeney and Cooper Connolly have earned spots in the 16-man squad for the two-Test series.
  • The series will take place in Galle, Sri Lanka.
"Sri Lanka is a challenging and exciting place to tour given the different conditions players may be presented with..." - George Bailey, Chief Selector

This series marks Australia’s last Test assignment before the World Test Championship final in June.
newTitle: Steve Smith to Lead Australia in Sri Lanka for Upcoming Test Series

title: 'Gangs of Pakistani rapists…': UK MPs vote against Tory's call for grooming gangs inquiry - Hindustan Times
summary:
UK's Labour government dismissed Conservatives' call for a national inquiry into grooming gangs, arguing it would delay crucial child protection legislation.

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The UK Labour government has dismissed a call from the Conservative Party for a national inquiry into grooming gangs, claiming it would hinder essential child protection legislation.

  • The Conservatives proposed a national inquiry tied to the 'Children’s Wellbeing and Schools Bill'.
  • The Labour MPs overwhelmingly rejected the motion, voting 364 against 111.
  • The bill focuses on strengthening child protection without delay.
  • Heated debates occurred in Parliament, with accusations of a “cover-up” from opposition leaders.
  • Criticism from shadow ministers highlighted concerns over the Labour Party's stance on the portrayal of child sexual abuse.
“The people need to know the truth about child sexual abuse by the grooming gangs,” said Nigel Farage during the debates.

The rejection of the inquiry by Labour has sparked criticism from opposition parties, raising questions about the government's commitment to addressing the grooming gangs issue.
newTitle: UK MPs Reject Inquiry Into Grooming Gangs Amid Legislative Debate

TCS Q3 Results LIVE: Tata Consultancy Services to report earnings today, shares rise - Upstox
summary:
TCS Q3 Results LIVE

Date: January 9, 2025

Source: Tata Consultancy Services

Shares of TCS were trading at ₹4,126, reflecting a gain of 0.44%, on the NSE. The latest October-December quarter results will be announced post market hours.

  • Market capitalisation stands at ₹14,96,169.64 crore.
  • Shares rose by 0.65% to ₹4,135.25 apiece.
  • Analysts predict flat revenue between ₹64,150 to ₹64,250 crore due to higher furloughs.
  • Potential net profit growth of 3%-4% to between ₹12,280 and ₹12,350 crore is expected.
The company has informed the Exchange about a Board Meeting to consider quarterly results and dividend.

Overall, anticipation around TCS's earnings report continues to create positive market sentiment.
newTitle: TCS Q3 Results Live: Earnings Announcement and Market Updates

title: Pravasi Bharatiya Divas LIVE: India will fulfill world’s demand for skilled talent, says PM Modi - The Hindu
summary:
Pravasi Bharatiya Divas LIVE: India will fulfill world’s demand for skilled talent, says PM Modi

Date: January 09, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the 18th Pravasi Bharatiya Divas convention, celebrating the contributions of the Indian diaspora to their homeland, with a focus on the theme “Diaspora’s contribution to a Viksit Bharat”.

  • Event held from January 8 to January 10, organized by the Ministry of External Affairs and Odisha government.
  • External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar emphasized the role of the diaspora in contributing to a developed India.
  • Prime Minister Modi asserted that India is a hub for skilled talent, willing to fulfill global demands.
  • Significant statements from global leaders recognizing India's contributions to global civilization.
“India will fulfill the world’s demand for skilled talent” - PM Modi

This event underscores India's aim to highlight the contributions of its diaspora to global development and promote skilled Indian youth abroad.
newTitle: Pravasi Bharatiya Divas LIVE: India will fulfill world’s demand for skilled talent, says PM Modi
